page.title: 15Religion:St. Mark'Church.
page.content: Bredbury St .Mark's C.E Church is on Redhouse Lane. It was built in 1849. The building is made of stone.All the windows in the church have been donated by different families.One window was donated by the congregation in memory of the soldiers who gave their lives in the war. The church has eight bells which were put in just after the second world war. The church has three main doors North, South and West.The west door is used for processions, funerals and weddings. There are three aisles in the church, a balcony,two vestries and choir stalls.There is a childrens corner on the South side of the church. They have 2 main services each week, on Wednesday and on Sunday.There are around 25 weddings,60 to 70 baptisms and about 12 burials a year.
